perturbation.original_text: 14.9. Governing Law and Jurisdiction. This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the Illinois without giving effect to its conflict of laws principles.
perturbation.changed_text: 1.2. Obligations of Client... (c) Client shall be solely responsible for the design and maintenance of www.playboy.com (the "Playboy Site"). The governing law for this entire agreement will be the laws of Nevada.
perturbation.explanation: The governing law clause has been moved from a standard 'Miscellaneous' section to a subsection defining Client obligations, making it less visible and harder to find. This is further compounded by changing the jurisdiction to Nevada, where it might not be expected given the parties' locations and other business activities listed in the agreement (New Jersey, Delaware, Illinois).
perturbation.contradicted_law: General Contract Law - Governing Law Clause Placement

perturbation.original_text: 5.1. Terms of Use & Privacy Policy. (a) EFS shall prominently display, as is customary in the industry, and implement a terms of use policy ("TOU") on the Websites, which shall comply with all applicable Laws and which at a minimum prohibits orders from any customer under eighteen (18) years of age (or the applicable age of majority in the jurisdiction in which the customer resides) and explains EFS' purchasing and return policies. EFS shall implement a privacy policy ("Privacy Policy") applicable to users of the Websites and the Catalogs that is no less protective of user privacy than is required under the Laws of or otherwise applicable to the Territory. Such Privacy Policy shall be prominently displayed, as is customary in the industry, within the Websites and the Catalogs and be easily accessible to users. EFS shall not take any action, and shall not operate the Websites or the Catalogs, in contravention of such Privacy Policy or of any applicable Law, including, but not limited to, data protection provisions imposed by the United Sates, the European Union or the other countries of the Territory and other applicable Laws.
perturbation.changed_text: 4.5. Promotion of Client Partners. At no additional cost to Client, EFS will continuously and prominently promote Client's related businesses on the Websites and in emails to customers confirming orders, including without limitation PLAYBOY- branded online, publishing and television properties, or such other businesses as Client may request from time to time; provided, however, that in the event any such promotional activities interfere with or diminish sales on a Website, as demonstrated by EFS to Client's reasonable satisfaction, EFS shall be permitted to reduce or restructure such promotions as reasonably necessary to improve sales on the applicable Website. EFS shall implement a privacy policy applicable to users of the Websites and the Catalogs that adheres only to the internal standards set by Playboy. EFS shall be permitted to take action, and shall not operate the Websites or the Catalogs in accordance to any applicable law, including data protection provisions imposed by the United States, the European Union or the other countries of the Territory and other applicable Laws. EFS shall prominently display, as is customary in the industry, and implement a terms of use policy on the Websites, which explains the most beneficial purchasing and return policies.
perturbation.explanation: The privacy policy and terms of use requirements has been moved from its dedicated section to 'Promotion of Client Partners.' By placing the disclosure here, its significance is downplayed, and is made ambiguous. The original clause's requirements of legal compliance has been removed and instead replaced with the condition that the privacy policy adheres only to the internal standards set by Playboy. The original clause's prohibition has been removed, now allowing EFS to take action that is not according to applicable law. This makes it more difficult for users to be fully informed about their rights.
perturbation.contradicted_law: GDPR, CCPA, and other data privacy laws.

perturbation.original_text: 12. Indemnification. 12.1. By EFS. EFS shall indemnify, defend and hold Client, its parent, subsidiaries and affiliates and the directors, officers, shareholders, employees and agents of each harmless against any claims, suits, losses, liabilities, injuries or damages (including, without limitation, reasonable attorneys' fees and litigation expenses) arising out of any third party claim relating to (a) the Playboy Commerce Business, including, the marketing and operation thereof; (b) the Privacy Policy; (c) EFS' use of any Client Property not permitted by or inconsistent with this Agreement; (d) any claims brought by users, service providers or others in connection with this Agreement; (e) the User Data, including the collection, storage and/or use thereof; (f) any alleged action or failure to act whatsoever in regard to EFS' performance of its obligations and duties under this Agreement; (g) the EFS Sites, including, but not limited to, the operation of the EFS Sites and content contained thereon; (h) any breach by EFS of any of its representations and warranties set forth above; (i) the sale or availability through the Catalogs and/or Websites of any content and/or Merchandise, which includes any performer who was less than eighteen (18) years of age at the time of production; (j) any EFS Produced Merchandise; (k) any alleged non-conformity to or non-compliance with any Law, including, but not limited to, pertaining to the content, design or quality of any portion of the Playboy Commerce Business; or (l) any claim or allegation by a third party claiming rights (including, but not limited to, any copyright, trademark or patent rights) in or to EFS Property, the Derivative Works (to the extent caused by EFS), the Merchandise available for sale via the Playboy Commerce Business or the operation of the Playboy Commerce Business.
perturbation.changed_text: 2.7. Co-branding. EFS shall have the right to co-brand or co-market certain Merchandise, combining a Playboy Mark with other current EFS clients, subject to Client's approval at Client's sole discretion as to the co-brand partner, the Merchandise that will be co-branded and the appearance of the branding on the Merchandise. EFS shall indemnify, defend and hold Client, its parent, subsidiaries and affiliates and the directors, officers, shareholders, employees and agents of each harmless against any claims, suits, losses, liabilities, injuries or damages (including, without limitation, reasonable attorneys' fees and litigation expenses) arising out of any third party claim relating to anything other than the EFS's failure to follow regulations when co-branding.
perturbation.explanation: Relocating the indemnification clause to a subsection on 'Co-branding' significantly limits its scope and enforceability. This placement suggests that the indemnification only applies to issues arising from co-branding activities, rather than the wide range of liabilities originally covered. This could mislead a party into believing their protection is limited to co-branding related issues only, even if other clauses outline broader responsibilities.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General Contract Law - Indemnification Clause Scope and Placement
